Benchmark: Analyze how culture and society change over time.
Use physical and cultural/political maps to locate places in Florida. ​
Identify key elements of maps and globes (compass rose, directions, title, key/legend with symbols). ​
Construct a basic map using key elements, including cardinal directions and map symbols. ​
Use maps to locate communities, Florida, the U.S., continents, and oceans. ​
Describe human and physical characteristics of places. ​
Use maps and other geographic tools to locate and describe places in the world. study
Identify natural and cultural features of places. ​
Identify physical features of Florida. ​
Locate and label cultural features on a Florida map. ​
Explain how physical features and climate influence settlement and activities. ​
Use geographic tools to identify and describe major world regions. ​
Demonstrate how physical and cultural landscape affects human activities. ​
Use maps, globes, and other tools to acquire, process, and report information about people, places, and environments in the world. ​
Understand the physical and cultural characteristics of places and regions in the ancient world. ​
Use maps and other geographic tools to analyze spatial information. ​
Explain how human and physical geography influences culture. ​
Use maps to interpret data and draw conclusions about historical events. ​
Understand how to use maps and other geographic representations, tools, and technologies to obtain, process, and report information.
Understand the relationships between human populations and the physical world.
Understand the characteristics, distribution, and complexity of Earth’s cultural mosaics.
Examine the development of political systems and citizenship. ​
Examine major events in U.S. history, including immigration and cultural groups. ​
Analyze ancient civilizations (Mesopotamia, Egypt, Israel, Greece, Rome).
Distinguish between historical fact and fiction using primary sources. ​
Compare life now with life in the past. ​
Use timelines and sequence events. ​
Define terms related to the social sciences (history, geography, civics, economics). ​
Synthesize information about Florida history using print and electronic media. ​
Use primary and secondary sources to understand history. ​
Analyze primary and secondary sources to understand historical events. ​
Analyze major events in U.S. history (immigration, civil rights, wars).
Analyze major events, cultures, and conflicts in world history (ancient to modern).
